title: Micron teams up with TSMC to deliver HBM4E, targeted for 2027 — collaboration could enable further customization
summary: Micron has confirmed it will partner with TSMC to manufacture the base logic die for its next-generation HBM4E memory, with production targeted for 2027.

title: Qualcomm's Snapdragon X2 Elite reference mini PC looks like a coaster — some designs are cooled by Frore AirJets
summary: Qualcomm has just unveiled its new X2 lineup of mobile SoCs, but they seem to be ready for the desktop as well, with mini PC reference designs. There's a frisbee-like circular design and a square device that can dock into an all-in-one base; both are thin and cooled by Frore's AirJet systems.

title: CoreWeave deal with OpenAI now worth $22.4 billion — another $6.4 billion of AI data center capacity added
summary: CoreWeave expands partnership to provide OpenAI with compute capacity.

title: SlimeMoldCrypt relies on gloopy living organism’s ever-changing network of tendrils for its dynamic, biological, encryption engine — inventor claims concept is resistant to decryption 'even by quantum machines'
summary: A new device hopes to harden cryptography by leveraging icky-sounding organisms called slime molds.

title: Sony unveils first-ever wireless desktop speakers for PC gamers with planar magnetic drivers — sleek design features microphone and battery, also work with Mac and PS5
summary: Sony took the wraps off its new Pulse Elevate wireless speakers during its State of Play event a few hours ago.

title: Intel reportedly raising prices on ever-popular Raptor Lake chips — 'outdated' CPUs to get over 10% price hike due to disinterest in AI processors
summary: Intel's Raptor Lake Refresh processors are expected to become more expensive because of increasing demand, despite being one generation behind the company's latest chips.

title: Intel taps Apple for potential investment, says report — companies said to be discussing ways to work together more closely
summary: Intel is reportedly in early talks with Apple about a potential investment and closer collaboration.

title: Raspberry Pi 500+ Review: RGB clicky keys and NVMe storage, but with a $200 price tag
summary: Raspberry Pi has released an updated version of the Raspberry Pi 500 and this time the omitted NVMe storage is present, as is an RGB mechanical keyboard.

title: A global hunt to uncover a virus deadlier than Covid-19
summary: Dr Chris van Tulleken investigates a mysterious virus that could cause the next pandemic

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female £1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first £1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: Lucy Bronze - the making of England's most decorated player
summary: This is the story of England defender Lucy Bronze, who is no stranger to winning and hopes for more success at Euro 2025.
